results.title: Basic computer terms
results.brief_description: Shows the utility of computers in the performance of routine administrative and business tasks. Outlines the steps in the computer process along with names of parts, terms usages.

results.title: Basic chemistry: family of halogens
results.brief_description: Shows the similarity and graduation of properties of the halogens and explains both the similarities and differences in degree on the basis of atomic structure. Looks at the properties of other families of elements in the Periodic Table. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Basic breadmaking
results.brief_description: Techniques of baking yeast bread are demonstrated for white loaf bread; crescent, cloverleaf and twist dinner rolls, also cinnamon rolls. Quick bread techniques are also shown for biscuits and muffins. Time-lapse photography is used during rising and baking processes.

results.title: Bashu: the little stranger
results.creator_credit: Bahram Beizai, A Zarin and Institute for the Intellectual Dev of Children and Young Adults
results.brief_description: A strong pacifist theme underlines this moving story of Bashu, a terrified ten year old who escapes the bombing that kills his family and destroys his village. Stowing away on a truck travelling from the South to the North, Bashu meets Nai, a woman who shelters him. Gradually Nai accepts him as a son and tries to initiate him into the ways of life in the region. They discover new grounds for a closer spiritual relationship when Nai keeps the boy despite objections from relatives and neighbours. Nai’s husband returns home, approves of his wife’s decision and adopts Bashu. This subtly crafted film was banned in Iran for six years and was only released after the Iran/Iraq war. Starring S. Taslimi, P. Poor Hosseini and A. Afravian. Persian language with English subtitles.

results.title: Bashful ballerina
results.brief_description: Imogene Coca is delightful as Miss Klutz, a pupil in the dance troupe of a Russian artiste named Kobelev. Miss Klutz is so clumsy - no matter how hard she tries to be a good dancer, her performances are always a disaster When a rival calls upon Kobelev to lend her ballet troupe a dancer, Miss Klutz gets the job…and the laughs that go with it. Cast also includes Eugene Sigaloff, Irene Moore, George Lessey, Alexander Asro, Alyce Chappelle, Buddy Page.

results.title: Based on Deception
results.creator_credit: Brian R. Everett and British Information Services
results.brief_description: An account of a British surveying expedition working at Deception Base in Antarctica. Shows the departure from London of the thirty-three people involved in the team, their arrival, life and work at Deception.

results.title: Base line measurements
results.brief_description: Illustrates the principles which lie behind the design and manufacture of survey equipment. This film explains in detail the method measuring a “Base Line” as a first stage in land survey by triangulation method. Emphasises the corrections which have to be made when using base line equipment to allow for errors due to gravity, direction and height above sea level. No other credits available.
results.description: Illustrates the principles which lie behind the design and manufacture of survey equipment. results.title: Barton Fink
results.creator_credit: Joel Coen, Ethan Coen and Circle Films
results.brief_description: New York City, 1941. Barton Fink is a successful Hollywood writer who has come to the land of the rich and famous to make it big in the movies. However, now that Hollywood has embraced him, he finds himself suffering from a severe case of writer’s block, has a movie mogul with a passion for wrestling breathing down his neck, and an insane insurance salesman wanting to separate his head from his neck. An enormously amusing crackpot view of the underside of the Hollywood dream and a wonderful, if slightly bizarre, investigation of the creative mind in turmoil. Cast includes John Turturro, John Goodman, Judy Davis, Michael Lerner and John Mahoney.

results.title: Bartleby
results.brief_description:
An adaptation of Herman Melville’s story about Bartleby, the scrivener, who answers an advertisement for work with a lawyer and after a brief spurt of intense work, gradually breaks down, refuses to move, and eventually dies because he has lost the will to live.

Credits: Director, Maurice Ronet ; writers, Yvan Bostel, Maurice Ronet, Jacques Quoirez ; photography, Claude Robin ; music, Gerard Anfosso.
Cast: Michel Lonsdale, Maxence Mailfort, Maurice Biraud, Dominique Zardi, Jacques Fontanelle.

results.title: Bartleby
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Herman Melville’s story about Bartleby, the scrivener, who answers an advertisement for work with a lawyer and after a brief spurt of intense work, gradually breaks down, refuses to move and eventually dies because he has lost the will to live. A detailed discussion and analysis of the story follows. Features a cameo appearance of the actor who played Greg Brady in the popular television series ‘The Brady Bunch’ as a law clerk.
